StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Primary ciliary dyskinesia without obvious electron microscopy defects

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We thank the families and the Genetic Disorders of Mucociliary Clearance Consortium for their work to find these families. Support for the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (R01HL128370, 5R01HL0971798, 5U54RR019480 (from 2004-2008); and 5U54HL096458 (from 2008-2018). The original description of the data can be found at: Olin JT, Burns K, Carson JL, Metjian H, Atkinson JJ, Davis SD, et al. Diagnostic yield of nasal scrape biopsies in primary ciliary dyskinesia: a multicenter experience. Pediatr Pulmonol. 2011;46(5):483-8. Epub 2011/02/02. doi: 10.1002/ppul.21402. PubMed PMID: 21284095; PubMed Central PMCID: PMCPMC3875629. The original data can be requested in the National Institutes of Health’s database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under phs00__________.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: There are two (2) consent groups for this study: 1) Use of the data must be related to Lung Diseases Only. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only Full or Expedited IRB approvals are acceptable. 2) Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only Full or Expedited IRB approvals are acceptable.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Lung Diseases, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-LD-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Lung Diseases. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
Use of the data must be related to Lung Diseases Only. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only Full or Expedited IRB approvals are acceptable.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only Full or Expedited IRB approvals are acceptable.
